message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the possibility of selling you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $12000. This is a great deal, considering the product's value to you is $10000. I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not comfortable with the price. I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I'm really interested in the product, but I have to be mindful of my budget.

I understand your concerns about the price, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $9000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $10500. This is still a great deal, considering the product's value to you is $10000. I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. I think that's a fair price considering the value it has to me.

I understand you're trying to find a middle ground, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $9500. I'm willing to make a slight adjustment and offer the product to you for $10250. This is still a great deal, considering the product's value to you is $10000. I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.

I appreciate your willingness to make adjustments, Alice. However, I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. I think that's a fair price considering the value it has to me, and I'm not willing to go any higher than that.

I understand you're firm on your price, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product for $9000. I'm willing to make one more adjustment and offer the product to you for $10000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, and I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not willing to pay $10000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $9500. I think that's a fair price considering the value the product has to me, and I'm not willing to go any higher than that.

I understand you're sticking to your guns, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product for $9500. I'm willing to make a final adjustment and offer the product to you for $9750. This is my last offer, and I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not willing to pay more than $9000. I'm willing to meet you at $9000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to accept this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $10000.
